WorkItem.ClosedComment: This feature was included in the 0.8.2 release.
WorkItem.Description:
I organized my .ts source files in subdirectories relative to the project root. However, the source map generated by tsc only lists the filenames, not the relative paths. So when I try to use the source map in a browser, I get 404 error messages because the browser looks for the files in the root directory instead of the respective subdirectories.

Example:

common.ts
module1/module1.ts
module2/module2.ts

compiled into project.ts.

project.ts.map lists them as:

"sources":["common.ts","module1.ts","module2.ts"],
WorkItem.Summary: Source maps do not list relative paths to source files

Comments.Message: Was just going through the commits to check out what has been fixed thus far and it looks like this was fixed with rev. 97c73b24ed1a (http://typescript.codeplex.com/SourceControl/changeset/97c73b24ed1a)
